intro: Galium parisiense var. australe, commonly known as the Australian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium parisiense var. australe is often found in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and grasslands.
